Header: Three storeyed Sri Somananda Mandiraya at the Sudharmarama Vihare in Talawathugoda declared open
Content: The new three storeyed Sri Somananda Mandiraya constructed at the Sudharmarama Vihare in Talawathugoda has been vested in the Maha Sangha. The event took place under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. The new three storeyed Sri Somananda Mandiraya of the Sudharmarama Vihare at Talawathugoda is equipped with a Dhamma Hall, a library and a Sanghawasa. The President unveiled the plaque and declared open the new three storeyed Mandiraya. The building put up with financial contributions made by the Dayaka Sabha cost 25 million rupees. Sri Somananda Sacred Relics and the Hair Relics brought by the Bosath Sri Lanka Foundation from Burma were also unveiled by the President for the devotees to pay homage. Members of the Maha Sangha led by Chief Incumbent of the Vihare the Ven. Prof. Kivulegedara Narada Thera chanted Seth Pirith and invoked blessings on the President. The President also handed over a memento to the President of the Bosath Sri Lanka Foundation K.A.D.M. Umesh Chathura. Mahanayake of the Udarata Amarapura Maha Nikaya the Most Ven. Nuwara Eliye Chandrajothi Thera handed over a special memento to the President. Members of the Maha Sangha including the Mahanayake of the Amarapura Dharma Rakshitha Mahanayake the Most Ven. Thirikumanamalaye Ananda Thera and a group including many Parliamentarians were present on the occasion.
